FuncDef:
The certificate load command loads a certificate to an SSL policy.
The undo certificate load command unloads a certificate from an SSL policy. The certificate load command loads a certificate to an SSL policy. The undo certificate load command unloads a certificate from an SSL policy. By default, no certificates are loaded to SSL policies.
CLIs: certificate load { pem-cert | pem-chain } <certFile> key-pair <keyType> key-file <keyFile> auth-code [ cipher <authCode> ]
certificate load pfx-cert <certFile> key-pair <keyType> key-file <keyFile> auth-code [ cipher <authCode> ]
certificate load pfx-cert <certFile> key-pair <keyType> mac [ cipher <macCode> auth-codecipher <authCode> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Loads a PEM certificate to an SSL policy.
The PEM format is most commonly used.
The PEM format is applicable to text files transmitted between systems.
-

Loads a PEM certificate chain to an SSL policy.
-

Specifies the name of a certificate file.
This file must be saved in the security sub-directory of the system directory.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters.
The name of this file must be the same as that of the file to be uploaded.
If spaces are used, the string must start and end with double quotation marks ("").

Indicates the key pair type.
Enumerated type. The options are as follows:
dsa: indicates that the key pair type is DSA.rsa: indicates that the key pair type is RSA.
To ensure high security, do not use the RSA key pair whose length is less than 3072 bits.

Specifies the name of a key pair file.
This file must be saved in the security sub-directory of the system directory.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters.
The name of this file must be the same as that of the file to be uploaded.
If spaces are used, the string must start and end with double quotation marks ("").

Specifies the authentication code of the key pair file.
The authentication code is used for identity authentication, ensuring that only authorized users can log in to a server.
The value is a string of  characters that can be letters or digits. The password can be a string of 1 to 31 characters in cleartext or a string of 32 to 168 characters in ciphertext.
The characters do not include the question mark (?) or spaces. However, when double quotation marks ("") are used around a password, spaces are allowed in the password.

Specifies the message authentication code.
The value is a string of case-sensitive characters that can be letters or digits. The password can be a string of 1 to 31 characters in cleartext or a string of 32 to 168 characters in ciphertext.

Loads a PFX certificate to an SSL policy.
The PFX format is a universal digital certificate format. The file name extension of a PFX digital certificate is .pfx.
The PFX format is a binary format that can be converted into the PEM format.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-ssl-policy-policy1] certificate load pem-cert servercert.pem key-pair dsa key-file serverkey.pem auth-code cipher YsHsjx_202206
[*HUAWEI-ssl-policy-policy1] certificate load pfx-cert servercert.pfx key-pair rsa key-file serverkey.pfx auth-code cipher YsHsjx_202206
[*HUAWEI-ssl-policy-policy1] certificate load pem-chain chain-servercert.pem key-pair rsa key-file chain-servercertkey.pem auth-code cipher YsHsjx_202206
